DOC.brief_summary: Treatment with PPARgamma ligands have been shown to reduces intestinal inflammation in murine models of colitis. The aim of this study was to evaluate the effect of treatment with local PPARgamma ligand (rosiglitazone) in distal ulcerative colitis.The patients are treated with rosiglitazone enema, once a day, for fourteen days. Disease activity was assessed before and after treatment by endoscopical and clinical activity score.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment With Local PPARgamma Ligand in Distal Ulcerative Colitis
DOC.criteria: Distal ulcerative colitis (Mayo Clinical Score > 7) Age > 18 years Written consent Age < 18 years Severe ulcerative colitis Systemic treatment with steroids or azathioprin within the last 3 month Known liver or kidney disease Severe heart failure Pregnancy or breast feeding
